ARABIC: نِّعْمَةً مِّنْ عِندِنَا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى مَن شَكَرَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: It was a blessing direct from Our presence. That is how We recompense those who give thanks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: As a favour from Us. That is how We reward the grateful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: as a favour from Us. Thus do We reward those who give thanks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Thus do We recompense the grateful ones.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: As a reward from Us; this is how We reward one who gives thanks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: As a favor from Us. Thus do We reward him who gives thanks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: A favor from Us; thus do We reward him who gives thanks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: a blessing from Us; even so We recompense him who is thankful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: As grace from Us. Thus We reward him who giveth thanks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: as a blessing from Us: this is how We reward the thankful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: As a favour from us. Thus We recompense him who giveth thanks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: as a blessing from Us. Thus do We reward those who give thanks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: As a Grace from Us: thus do We reward those who give thanks.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: As a Favour from Us, thus do We reward him who gives thanks (by obeying Us).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: through Our Mercy. So it is that We recompense the thankful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: A blessing from Us. Thus We reward the thankful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: As favor from us. Thus do We reward he who is grateful.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [54:35] as a grace (ni‘matan is a verbal noun, that is to say in‘āman, ‘an act of grace’) from Us. So, like that requital, do We requite him who gives thanks, for Our graces and is a believer, or [it means] him who is a believer in God and His messenger and is obedient to both.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (As grace from Us) as mercy from Us. (Thus We reward him who gives thanks) thus We save he who believes in Our divine Oneness and gives thanks for Our bounty.
